dt: {bc}to fasten or fix by piercing or thrusting in
{bc}to impress firmly in the consciousness or disposition
{bc}to insert (a sound or letter) as an infix

pt: {sc}implant{/sc} {sc}inculcate{/sc} {sc}instill{/sc} {sc}inseminate{/sc} {sc}infix{/sc} mean to introduce into the mind. {sc}implant{/sc} implies teaching that makes for permanence of what is taught.

pt.t: {it}implanted{/it} a love of reading in her students

pt: {sc}inculcate{/sc} implies persistent or repeated efforts to impress on the mind.

pt.t: tried to {it}inculcate{/it} in him high moral standards

pt: {sc}instill{/sc} stresses gradual, gentle imparting of knowledge over a long period of time.
{sc}inseminate{/sc} applies to a sowing of ideas in many minds so that they spread through a class or nation.
{sc}infix{/sc} stresses firmly inculcating a habit of thought.

et: Latin {it}infixus{/it}, past participle of {it}infigere{/it}, from {it}in-{/it} + {it}figere{/it} to fasten {ma}{mat|fix|}{/ma}
shortdef: to fasten or fix by piercing or thrusting in
to impress firmly in the consciousness or disposition
to insert (a sound or letter) as an infix

dt: {bc}a derivational or inflectional affix appearing in the body of a word (such as Sanskrit {it}-n-{/it} in {it}vindami{/it} "I know" as contrasted with {it}vid{/it} "to know")

shortdef: a derivational or inflectional affix appearing in the body of a word (such as Sanskrit -n- in vindami "I know" as contrasted with vid "to know")

dt: {bc}characterized by placement of a binary operator between the operands

shortdef: characterized by placement of a binary operator between the operands
